{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3478948,"name":"Pih Lung Pang","username":"Jadedragon","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/ee59a6/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-11T06:22:44.241Z","cooked":"

This is my first season as Mentor for team 2478. I would appreciate any feedback/help how to best implement apriltag and object detection to our robot using an OrangePi 5 Plus(or RPi4/5) and an Arducam IMX586.
What software stack should we use? The Ubuntu versions available for OrangePi seems to be very limited compare to Raspberry Pi. Could some of the teams that uses Orange Pi share what OS and framework they are using. Or even share a github repository with code snippet to get us going?
Can OrangePi(RaspberryPi) only communicate with the RoboRio 2.0 with Tcp or UDP packages? I saw that a team tried to develop ROS2 for the robot(Team 2383), did that include pub/sub communication between RoboRio,Orangepi, (Ardu)Cam, Motors controllers? What are the main challenges of using ROS2 for FRC 2025 season?

Any feedback on some of my questions are appreciated!
Thanks
JadeDragon

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2025-01-11T06:22:44.241Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":320,"reads":271,"readers_count":270,"score":1649.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":480872,"topic_slug":"apriltag-detection-and-ros2-robot-for-reefscape-frc-season","display_username":"Pih Lung Pang","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":69255,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/apriltag-detection-and-ros2-robot-for-reefscape-frc-season/480872/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3478951,"name":"Guy","username":"Haxo","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/haxo/{size}/132812_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-11T06:28:12.119Z","cooked":"

The best software for vision in frc without doing a lot of custom work is photonvision. It supports april tags, object detection etc. It works on the orange pi and supports arducams

photonvision.org

PhotonVision

PhotonVision is the free, fast, and easy-to-use computer vision solution for the FIRST Robotics Competition.

The Zebracorns, team 900, are well known for their use of ROS (seven seasons now) and have a lot of good info on their team website. The regularly publish white papers on technical topics, including ROS and have all their code public. Take a look at their Zebracorn Labs page to see what they have. I can tell you that they were using both Apriltag and object detection in 2024, so they might well have the solution you need, or at least good advice on where to start.

Yes, coprocessors have access to TCP/UDP over Ethernet. The built-in and fully integrated pub/sub infrastructure for FRC is called NetworkTables (NT), part of the WPILib project. The implementation is portable to and available for coprocessors, and the existing COTS vision solutions including Limelight and PhotonVision use NT to talk to the robot code. A few teams have successfully used ROS, but it is not a common solution for FRC and takes a lot of work to set up.

Team 195 is doing very impressive ROS2 work as well!

Team 195 2024 ROS2 Quick Start + Code Release Programming
Hi everyone, Team 195 - CyberKnights is proud to present our 2024 robot code! Including a guide to getting started with ROS2 for FRC. Here you will find our main robot project. The README should contain everything you need to get up and running with running our ROS2 project locally in a simulator. Both Windows and Linux are currently supported. [IMG_5447] If you have any questions about anything, please feel free to ask to help others and to help us improve our instructions!

You are still using ROS1, did you experiment with ROS2? Is ROS2 not mature enough?

Sorry, I don’t have an answer for you since I’m not on the Zebracorns. Our team (4829 Titanium Tigers) is in FIRST NC with the Zebracorns and have a fair bit of interaction with them, but we still use Java for programming. I honestly don’t know why they use ROS1 vs. ROS2. My advice is to contact them directly and ask. They’ve always been a team that is more than happy to help others and give advice.

Can’t speak for them but as someone who uses ROS in a professional capacity, that’s basically it.

The zebracorns ROS work predates stable ROS 2, and the transition is not fun, and there really isn’t much of a benefit for doing so either.
